title: CPweaR - CPR Training Feedback
summary: Track and monitor your CPR quality!

descriptionHTML:
Track and monitor your CPR quality! CPweaR is a smartwatch/smartphone solution to provide CPR feedback through readouts of a CPR provider's quality of CPR.

To use the application properly, follow the guidelines provided by this link: http://depts.washington.edu/learncpr/quickcpr.html.

The android wear device strapped to your wrist should be able to record CPR data while you are performing CPR compressions on a victim.


Mobile:
The app measures Rate, Angle, and Depth, all of which are crucial to providing quality CPR vital to saving lives.

Audible feedback also exists on the mobile device to alert the user if they are going too fast, too slow, too deep or too shallow.

View your sessions after you're done! The Summary Screen provides statistics of your last CPR session, along with a calendar selector to view statistics for previous CPR sessions.



Android Wear:
CPweaR requires a compatible Android Wear device for proper operation. The wearable acts as the data collecting device, which measures the CPR metrics, which is sent back to the phone for database storage and audible feedback.

Ensure that your Android Wear device is properly paired to your android smartphone before using this application.




Developed in collaboration with:
UC Davis Medical Center - Sacramento, CA
UC Davis Computer Science Department - Davis, CA
Dave - Test subject




DISCLAIMER: CPweaR’s purpose is to aid users as a training tool. Use of this app and related hardware is at your own risk. CPweaR does not replace the advice of medical professionals. Failure to properly use CPweaR may result in bodily injury, harm, and death. CPweaR is not liable for any improper or incorrect use of the application or the hardware associated with CPweaR. CPweaR shall not be held liable for any direct, direct, special, incidental, or consequential damages resulting from the usage of CPweaR and the hardware associated with CPweaR.
Those inexperienced with CPR (Cardiopulmonary resuscitation) or the usage of CPweaR should seek the assistance and/or guidance of a certified CPR provider and/or medical professional.



The American Heart Association Disclaimer:
The American Heart Association strongly promotes knowledge and proficiency in BLS, ACLS, and PALS and has developed instructional materials for this purpose. Use of these materials in an educational course does not represent course sponsorship by the American Heart Association. Any fees charged for such a course, except for a portion of fees needed for AHA course materials do not represent income to the Association.

Developed with the following APIs:
Summary Charts - MPAndroidCharts (https://github.com/PhilJay/MPAndroidChart)
Calendar View for Session selection - (https://github.com/SundeepK/CompactCalendarView)
Material Design Icons - https://github.com/alexjlockwood/material-check-mark-animation
Watch Circle Animation - https://github.com/jhw-dev/CircleLoadingView
